faqs.question: What are the key maintenance charges associated with owning a flat in Ghel society
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges typically cover common area expenses such as security personnel salaries, lift maintenance, common area lighting, garbage disposal services, water supply pumps, and upkeep of parks or clubhouses if applicable. Prospective buyers should budget between INR 1800 and INR 3500 monthly, but this figure must be verified with the Resident Welfare Association (RWA) of the specific apartment complex you are interested in.

faqs.question: What is the difference between carpet area built-up area and super built-up area in Ghel flats
faqs.answer: The carpet area is the actual usable area within the walls of your apartment. Built-up area includes the carpet area plus the thickness of the inner walls and balcony space. Super built-up area is the built-up area plus a proportionate share of the common amenities like lobbies, stairs, lifts, and corridors. When looking for a Flat For Sale in Ghel, always clarify the price based on the carpet area, as this accurately reflects the space you will inhabit.
